Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
Here‚Äôs my thoughts:

We approach either the head of ministry of finance directly (I provided Steve his contact information already) we will either get him or one of the gatekeepers to him (intern, secretary, etc) in order to try and get a meeting with him to present the Komodo capabilities and our proposal of how we can help build their coin.

some of the key points we should touch on:
Being a nation of islands, roughly 400,000 people. With 255,000 living in Nassau and 50,000 living in Freeport, while the rest are spread out farther, they could start with a pilot program as their own independent chain (built on Komodo) and utilizing dPoW (to give it Bitcoin level security) so they don‚Äôt have the restrictions of Ethereum transaction costs and congestions. They can set their own transaction fees (which can be thought of as sales tax or something) in which a small percent of transaction fee transfers to the governments wallet (I believe this is called Override Commission.) They currently have a 7.5% sales tax but they could offer discounts if people use the coin. This will encourage people to use crypto there (as its cheaper than paying the higher tax, assuming they are honest merchants and report). This lower tax if using crypto will actually help their program be more successful (looks good politically) and allows them to account for tax collections much more efficiently (override commission).

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
The government could simply do the accounting for all the wallet transaction fees and use those funds to sell on the open market and pay for other things if they choose, or they can pay for redistribute it back to the wallet address via airdrop for whatever reason they deem necessary.
And if they are ready to scale, hopefully our scaling solutions will be ready, and show the burn protocol to combat inflation when people move island to island. There also exists the ability for them to provide a measure of QE if they deem its needed in the future (not a huge fan of it, but the option exists).

They could even offer a period of greater tax benefits or discounts to tourists who use the currency.

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: @jl777c I believe kind of "banking app" is a must in that case to make it smooth. By banking app I mean sth like in online banking where you can schedule payments / outgoing transfers with 2FA + you can set up 3rd party (not necessary a bank - might be your friend)  as someone who double secures your actions or settings changes / by smart contracts?).  I was thinking to go mainstream people need some kind of "passphrase/settings reset" which might be achieved maybe thanks to smart contracts and setting up some dependiecies 3rd parties who secures your money? BAnking then will switch to creating this security/backing up clients and even obtaining insurance maybe ... I'm thinking from user perspective, people not ready / not really aware security here is even more important, as you all your money are digital - if lost you have no money. Currently it's easier - if uou have these papers with numbers (and you live in US) in your wallet a hacker from Brazil will not take those papers from you.

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: So actually any gov will abandon this project after realising people not ready / loosing money. At least national bank must be able to easy back it up somehow... To reset/restore keys (or other possibility of transfering account balance) when someone will come with ID to prove identity or sth like that.

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: How to prevent hacking may be most tricky. Separate token device might be useful. I personally do not use banking on cellphone. So my cellphone is a separate token. But most people use cellphones as primary + token, 2 in 1 which I consider not safe.

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: Think of the blockchain as a word processor that can write any document you want. Not having any specific document just means you need to write it, doesnt mean that the word processor cant create it. [replace "word processor" with "blockchain" and "document" with "transaction"] I (we) cant possibly write all the possible documents that might ever be desired by anyone. For now, we create the general purpose word processor and write custom documents when there is a big customer
